content.title: Finding Your Place
content.setup: {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} looks you over after the morning drill. 'You've proven yourself, {PLAYER_NAME}. Time to find your place in the line. What are you trained for?'

options.text: "The shield wall. I'll hold the line."
options.tooltip: Join the infantry formation. You'll train with sword, shield, and polearm.
options.outcome: The sergeant nods. 'Good. Infantry is the backbone of any army. Report to the Quartermaster for your kit.'

options.text: "Give me a bow. I'll strike from distance."
options.tooltip: Join the archer formation. You'll train with bow, crossbow, and skirmish tactics.
options.outcome: The sergeant studies your hands. 'Steady grip. Good. Archers win battles before they start. Report to the Quartermaster for your kit.'

options.text: "Put me on a horse. I'll ride with the lancers."
options.tooltip: Join the cavalry formation. You'll train with lance, sword, and mounted tactics.
options.outcome: The sergeant grins. 'A horseman, eh? The cavalry always needs more riders. Report to the Quartermaster for your kit.'

options.tooltip: Join the horse archer formation. You'll train in mounted archery and skirmish.
options.outcome: The sergeant raises an eyebrow. 'A rare skill. We need riders who can fight without stopping. Report to the Quartermaster for your kit.'

content.title: The Sergeant's Test
content.setup: {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} pulls you aside after camp is set. 'The men look up to you now, {PLAYER_NAME}. But leading isn't just about fighting. Tell me — a recruit loses his rations gambling. What do you do?'

options.text: "Discipline him publicly. The men need to see consequences."
options.tooltip: Take a hardline approach to discipline.
options.outcome: {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} nods slowly. 'Hard but fair. The men will respect that. You're ready for the next rank, {NEXT_RANK}.'

options.text: "Give him a chance to earn it back. One mistake shouldn't define a man."
options.tooltip: Show mercy and give a second chance.
options.outcome: {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} smiles faintly. 'Compassion has its place. The men will remember your kindness. Welcome to {NEXT_RANK}.'

options.text: "Make him work extra duties until the debt is paid. Idle hands cause trouble."
options.outcome: {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} chuckles. 'Practical. I like it. You think like a soldier should. Congratulations, {NEXT_RANK}.'

content.title: Crisis of Command
content.setup:
The battle was chaos. {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} went down with an arrow to the shoulder, and the line wavered. For a moment, all eyes turned to you. Now, in the aftermath, {LORD_NAME} summons you.

'I heard what happened out there,' the lord says. 'The men say you held them together. Tell me what you did.'

options.text: "I led the charge. We couldn't let them regroup."
options.tooltip: You took the fight to the enemy.
options.outcome: {LORD_NAME} nods approvingly. 'Bold action wins wars. You've earned your place among the {NEXT_RANK}s. Don't let me down.'

options.text: "I held the line and protected the wounded. We couldn't abandon our own."
options.tooltip: You prioritized defense and protecting allies.
options.outcome: {LORD_NAME} regards you thoughtfully. 'Loyalty to your comrades is rare these days. The rank of {NEXT_RANK} suits you. Lead them well.'

options.text: "I read the battlefield and ordered a tactical withdrawal to better ground."
options.tooltip: You made a calculated tactical decision.
options.outcome: {LORD_NAME}'s eyes narrow with respect. 'A thinking soldier. We need more of those. You're {NEXT_RANK} now. Use that head of yours.'

content.title: The Lance's Vote
content.setup:
The veterans of your lance gather around the fire. {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} stands and clears his throat.

'We've been watching you, {PLAYER_NAME}. Some of us think you're ready to wear the stripes of {NEXT_RANK}. But rank isn't given — it's earned by the trust of those you lead.'

The men look to you expectantly. This is your moment to speak.

options.text: "I'm nothing without this lance. Whatever you decide, I'll accept."
options.tooltip: Show humility and defer to the group.
options.outcome: The men exchange glances and nod. {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} claps you on the shoulder. 'That's the right answer. Welcome to {NEXT_RANK}, soldier. The lance has spoken.'

options.text: "I've bled with you. Fought beside you. I'm ready to lead you."
options.outcome: {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} grins. 'Confidence. Good. A {NEXT_RANK} needs that.' The veterans raise their cups. 'To {PLAYER_NAME}!'

options.text: "Give me the chance, and I swear no one in this lance goes hungry or forgotten."
options.tooltip: Make a promise to look after your men.
options.outcome: Silence falls. Then {SECOND_SHORT} stands. 'I believe him.' One by one, the others nod. {LANCE_LEADER_SHORT} smiles. 'Then it's decided. {NEXT_RANK} {PLAYER_NAME}.'

content.title: Audience with the Lord
content.setup:
{LORD_NAME} summons you to the command tent. The banner of {FACTION_NAME} hangs behind the campaign table where the lord sits reviewing dispatches.

'You've served well, {PLAYER_NAME}. Your name comes up often in the reports. The rank of {NEXT_RANK} is mine to give — but first, I must know where your loyalty lies.'

options.text: "My sword belongs to you, my lord. Command, and I obey."
options.tooltip: Pledge personal loyalty to your lord.
options.outcome: {LORD_NAME} rises and draws a blade, touching it to your shoulder. 'Then rise, {NEXT_RANK}. Your oath is accepted. Serve me well, and glory shall be yours.'

options.text: "My loyalty is to {KINGDOM_NAME} and its people. I serve the realm."
options.tooltip: Pledge loyalty to the kingdom rather than the individual.
options.outcome: {LORD_NAME} pauses, then nods slowly. 'A principled answer. The realm needs soldiers like you. You are {NEXT_RANK} now. May you serve the kingdom with honor.'

options.text: "My loyalty is to the soldiers beside me. They're why I fight."
options.tooltip: Declare loyalty to your comrades above politics.
options.outcome: {LORD_NAME} studies you for a long moment. 'Rare, to find such devotion to the common soldier. Very well, {NEXT_RANK}. Lead your men. I suspect they'd follow you anywhere.'
